title: Marat Safin
summary: Marat Mubinovich Safin [note 1] (born 27 January 1980) is a Russian retired world No. 1 tennis player and former politician.[2] He achieved the Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP) world No. 1 singles ranking on 20 November 2000. Safin is also the older brother of former WTA world No. 1 player Dinara Safina. They are the only brother-sister tandem in tennis history who have both achieved No. 1 rankings.[3][4]
